perturbation.original_text: 1.1      "Maximum Daily Delivery Obligation (MDDO)" means the maximum                   daily quantity of natural gas, expressed in Dekatherms (Dth),                   that Transporter is obligated to deliver from time to time at                   the Point(s) of Delivery specified in Exhibit B to the                   executed Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1      "Maximum Daily Delivery Obligation (MDDO)" means the average                   daily quantity of natural gas, expressed in Dekatherms (Dth),                   that Transporter is obligated to deliver from time to time at                   the Point(s) of Delivery specified in Exhibit B to the                   executed Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'maximum' to 'average' in the definition of MDDO creates a contradiction. Later clauses rely on MDDO as a maximum limit, leading to uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
5.1      Subject to the General Terms and Conditions of Transporter's                   FERC Gas Tariff and Rate Schedule FTS/ITS, this Agreement                   shall be effective as of the date of physical completion of                   and initial deliveries on Transporter's pipeline and shall                   continue for a primary term of ten years. Thereafter, this




                  Agreement shall be effective month to month, until terminated                   by Transporter or Shipper upon the following written notice to                   the other specifying a termination date: sixty (60) days for

                  interruptible transportation under Rate Schedule ITS and 180                   days for firm transportation under Rate Schedule FTS.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1      Subject to the General Terms and Conditions of Transporter's                   FERC Gas Tariff and Rate Schedule FTS/ITS, this Agreement                   shall be effective as of the date of physical completion of                   and initial deliveries on Transporter's pipeline and shall                   continue for a primary term of ten years. Thereafter, this




                  Agreement shall be effective year to year, until terminated                   by Transporter or Shipper upon the following written notice to                   the other specifying a termination date: sixty (60) days for

                  interruptible transportation under Rate Schedule ITS and 180                   days for firm transportation under Rate Schedule FTS.
perturbation.explanation: The contract initially mentions 'month to month' as the term post the 'primary term' of 10 years. Changing this to 'year to year' creates conflicting obligations since it is unclear what the exact agreement is after the initial term.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1      Amendment. This Agreement shall only be amended, varied or                   modified by an instrument in writing executed by Transporter                   and Shipper. Such amendment will be effective upon compliance                   with Article VIII herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1      Amendment. This Agreement shall only be amended, varied or                   modified by an instrument in writing executed by Transporter                   or Shipper. Such amendment will be effective upon compliance                   with Article VIII herein.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'and' to 'or' in the amendment clause allows either party to unilaterally amend the agreement. This directly contradicts the initial requirement of mutual agreement, creating uncertainty in the enforcement of any amendments. This change affects the balance of power and contractual integrity.
